my:Hazard.my:Description: Risks from physical, biological and chemical agents
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: a) If a task is detailed as being 'Prohibited for Young Seafarers' in the General Guidance book then this must be obeyed and the task must not be undertaken. b) If the task involves any risk from agents, work and processes as outlined in the General Guidance for Young Persons / Seafarers then the task is prohibited unless being performed under direct supervision of a competent person and forming part of an established training programme. c) A Health assessment must be conducted before and at regular intervals during a prohibited task, as per General Guidance for Young Persons / Seafarers.

a) Night work is only permitted when in accordance with an established training program. b) RWH regulations are different for Young Persons - MLC 2006 - Title 2, Regulation 2.3. c) A Health assessment must be conducted before and at regular intervals during night work, as per General Guidance for Young Persons /Seafarers.

my:Hazard.my:Description: Insufficient awareness of physical and / or mental risks
my:Hazard.my:ControlMeasures: If the Young Person is not aware of the physical and or mental risks associated with the task then they are not to undertake the work.
